evidence.title: README (segment 2)
evidence.excerpt: See https://swift.org/LICENSE.txt for license information See https://swift.org/CONTRIBUTORS.txt for Swift project authors -->

evidence.title: README (segment 3)
evidence.excerpt: Swift Testing is a package with expressive and intuitive APIs that make testing your Swift code a breeze.

evidence.title: README (segment 4)
evidence.excerpt: [![CI status badge for main branch using main toolchain](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/actions/workflows/main_using_main.yml/badge.svg?branch=main&event=push)](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/actions/workflows/main_using_main.yml) [![CI status badge for main branch using 6.3 toolchain](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/actions/workflows/main_using_release.yml/badge.svg?branch=main&event=push)](https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/actions/workflows/main_using_release.yml)

evidence.title: README (segment 5)
evidence.excerpt: Swift Testing has a clear and expressive API built using macros, so you can declare complex behaviors with a small amount of code. The `#expect` API uses Swift expressions and operators, and captures the evaluated values so you can quickly understand what went wrong when a test fails.

evidence.title: README (segment 6)
evidence.excerpt: @Test func helloWorld() { let greeting = "Hello, world!" #expect(greeting == "Hello") // Expectation failed: (greeting â†’ "Hello, world!") == "Hello" } ```

evidence.title: README (segment 7)
evidence.excerpt: You can customize the behavior of tests or test suites using traits specified in your code. Traits can describe the runtime conditions for a test, like which device a test should run on, or limit a test to certain operating system versions. Traits can also help you use continuous integration effectively by specifying execution time limits for your tests.

evidence.title: README (segment 8)
evidence.excerpt: ```swift @Test(.enabled(if: AppFeatures.isCommentingEnabled)) func videoCommenting() async throws { let video = try #require(await videoLibrary.video(named: "A Beach")) #expect(video.comments.contains("So picturesque!")) } ```

evidence.title: swift-6.2.3-RELEASE
evidence.excerpt: ## What's Changed * [6.2] Ensure `NonisolatedNonsendingByDefault` doesn't break exit tests by @stmontgomery in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/1421 * Update the Swift version to 6.2.3 by @shahmishal in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/1433 **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/compare/swift-6.2.2-RELEASE...swift-6.2.3-RELEASE

evidence.title: swift-6.2.2-RELEASE
evidence.excerpt: ## What's Changed * [6.2.2] Update branch version by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/1411 * [6.2.2] Ensure `NonisolatedNonsendingByDefault` doesn't break exit tests. by @grynspan in https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/pull/1407 **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/swiftlang/swift-testing/compare/swift-6.2.1-RELEASE...swift-6.2.2-RELEASE
